job description:
Bioinformatics Scientist
If you are a Bioinformatics Scientist with NGS experience, this is an amazing opportunity for you!

What You Will Be Doing
Bioinformatics Scientist for leading edge molecular laboratory. This role is primarily a genomics analyst position assisting R&D in developing advanced NGS pipelines for targeted cancer therapies. The role is also responsible for developing bioinformatics pipelines for validation and troubleshooting of assays for prospective clinical trials.
  • Lead the Development, analytical testing and validation of new bioinformatic pipelines to improve clinical diagnostic NGS platform with an emphasis on rigorous validation and robust procedures.
  • Assist with drafting and completing government applications (NIH, FDA, NYS, CLIA, CAP) and manuscripts for publication
  • Lead data analysis and interpretation of study results throughout application/publication process
  • Enhance existing bioinformatics methods, improving their assay capabilities as well as their technical robustness.
  • Monitor and evaluate analytical aspects of new and emerging technologies.
  • Process, analyze, and interpret high volumes of data for the development and validation of methods.
  • Present scientific and technical data to colleagues.
What You Need for this Position
  • Masters or PhD in related field
  • NGS
  • dry lab
  • DNA
  • Large genomics datasets (RNAseq profiling, CNV analysis, bioinformatics QC of libraries, TCGA, somatic variant analysis)
  • Expert in BASH and scripting languages
  • Linux/Unix terminal/command line-only
What's In It for You
  • Vacation/PTO
  • Medical
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • 401k
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Relocation Assistance
So, if you are a Bioinformatics Scientist with NGS experience, please apply today! And save lives by improving patient care.
